name: Bubblegum.Entity.Validation

values.name: asBool
values.comment:
Convert a String to a Float otherwise raise a warning

    Valid "true" |> asBool -- Valid True

values.name: asFloat
values.comment:
Convert a String to a Float otherwise raise a warning

    Valid "12.3" |> asFloat -- Valid 12.3

values.name: asFloatRange
values.comment:
Check that first value is strictly less than the second otherwise raise a warning

    Valid (3.5, 5.5) |> asFloatRange -- Valid (3.5, 5.5)
values.type: Bubblegum.Entity.Outcome.Outcome ( Float, Float ) -> Bubblegum.Entity.Outcome.Outcome ( Float, Float )

values.name: asFloatTuple
values.comment:
Convert a tuple of String to a tuple of Float otherwise raise a warning

    Valid ("3.5", "5.5") |> asFloatTuple -- Valid (3.5, 5.5)
values.type: Bubblegum.Entity.Outcome.Outcome ( String, String ) -> Bubblegum.Entity.Outcome.Outcome ( Float, Float )

values.name: asInt
values.comment:
Convert a String to an Int otherwise raise a warning

    Valid "12" |> asInt -- Valid 12

values.name: asIntRange
values.comment:
Check that first value is strictly less than the second otherwise raise a warning

    Valid (3, 5) |> asIntRange -- Valid (3, 5)
values.type: Bubblegum.Entity.Outcome.Outcome ( Int, Int ) -> Bubblegum.Entity.Outcome.Outcome ( Int, Int )

values.name: asIntTuple
values.comment:
Convert a tuple of String to a tuple of Int otherwise raise a warning

    Valid ("3", "5") |> asIntTuple -- Valid (3, 5)
values.type: Bubblegum.Entity.Outcome.Outcome ( String, String ) -> Bubblegum.Entity.Outcome.Outcome ( Int, Int )

values.name: asSingle
values.comment:
Convert a list with only one string to a single string.

    Valid ["alpha"] |> asSingle -- Valid "alpha"

values.name: asTuple
values.comment:
Convert a tuple of singleton list to a tuple of String

    Valid (["min"], ["max"]) |> asTuple -- Valid ("min", "max")
values.type: Bubblegum.Entity.Outcome.Outcome ( List String, List String ) -> Bubblegum.Entity.Outcome.Outcome ( String, String )

values.name: asUnique
values.comment:
Enforce that the list to be unique

    Valid ["alpha", "beta", "alpha"] |> asUnique -- Valid ["alpha", "beta"]

values.name: listEqual
values.comment:
Ensure that the list equal a given size otherwise raise a warning

    Valid ["alpha", "beta"] |> listEqual 2 -- Valid ["alpha", "beta"]

values.name: listLessThan
values.comment:
Ensure that the list equal or less than a given size otherwise raise a warning

    Valid ["alpha", "beta"] |> listLessThan 2 -- Valid ["alpha", "beta"]

values.name: listMoreThan
values.comment:
Ensure that the list equal or more than a given size otherwise raise a warning

    Valid ["alpha", "beta"] |> listMoreThan 2 -- Valid ["alpha", "beta"]

values.name: listStrictlyLessThan
values.comment:
Ensure that the list is strictly less than a given size otherwise raise a warning

    Valid ["alpha", "beta"] |> listStrictlyLessThan 3 -- Valid ["alpha", "beta"]

values.name: listStrictlyMoreThan
values.comment:
Ensure that the list is strictly more than a given size otherwise raise a warning

    Valid ["alpha", "beta"] |> listStrictlyMoreThan 1 -- Valid ["alpha", "beta"]

values.name: matchAbsoluteUrl
values.comment:
Check whether a string matches an absolute URL otherwise raise a warning

    Valid "http://bbc.co.uk" |> matchAbsoluteUrl -- Valid "http://bbc.co.uk"

values.name: matchCompactUri
values.comment:
Check whether a string matches an absolute URL otherwise raise a warning.

    The prefix should not exceed 15 characters.

    Valid "uri:a/b001/c" |> matchCompactUri -- Valid "uri:a/b001/c"

values.name: matchEnum
values.comment:
Check that a string belong to an enumeration otherwise raise a warning

    Valid ["alpha"] |> matchEnum ["beta", "alpha"] -- Valid ["alpha"]
values.type: List String -> Bubblegum.Entity.Outcome.Outcome String -> Bubblegum.Entity.Outcome.Outcome String

values.name: matchNormalizedString
values.comment:
Check that a string is a [normalized string](https://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema11-2/#normalizedString)

    Valid "some string" |> matchNormalizedString -- Valid "some string"

values.name: matchRegex
values.comment:
Check whether a string matches a regular expression otherwise raise a warning

    Valid "abc" |> matchRegex "[a-z]+" -- Valid "abc"

values.name: stringContains
values.comment:
Check that a string contains a term otherwise raise a warning

    Valid ["blue red green"] |> stringContains "red" -- Valid ["blue red green"]

values.name: stringEndsWith
values.comment:
Check that a string ends with a suffix otherwise raise a warning

    Valid ["image.jpg"] |> stringEndsWith ".jpg" -- Valid ["image.jpg"]

values.name: stringStartsWith
values.comment:
Check that a string starts with a prefix otherwise raise a warning

    Valid ["ui:label"] |> stringStartsWith "ui:" -- Valid ["ui:label"]

values.name: withinFloatRange
values.comment:
Check a tuple of Float is within the range of a given range otherwise raise a warning

    Valid (3.5, 5.2) |> withinFloatRange (2.1, 7.2) -- Valid (3.5, 5.2)
values.type: ( Float, Float ) -> Bubblegum.Entity.Outcome.Outcome ( Float, Float ) -> Bubblegum.Entity.Outcome.Outcome ( Float, Float )

values.name: withinIntRange
values.comment:
Check a tuple of Int is within the range of a given range otherwise raise a warning

    Valid (3, 5) |> withinIntRange (2, 7) -- Valid (3, 5)
values.type: ( Int, Int ) -> Bubblegum.Entity.Outcome.Outcome ( Int, Int ) -> Bubblegum.Entity.Outcome.Outcome ( Int, Int )

values.name: withinListStringCharsRange
values.comment:
Check that all the strings' number of characters are within a range otherwise raise a warning

    Valid ["abc", "abcd"] |> withinListStringCharsRange (2, 7) -- Valid "abcd"
values.type: ( Int, Int ) -> Bubblegum.Entity.Outcome.Outcome (List String) -> Bubblegum.Entity.Outcome.Outcome (List String)

values.name: withinStringCharsRange
values.comment:
Check that a string number of characters is within a range otherwise raise a warning

    Valid "abcd" |> withinStringCharsRange (2, 7) -- Valid "abcd"
values.type: ( Int, Int ) -> Bubblegum.Entity.Outcome.Outcome String -> Bubblegum.Entity.Outcome.Outcome String

name: Bubblegum.Entity.StateEntity
comment:
A state entity represents the state that could be applied to a widget

@docs Model, setAttributes, asAttributesIn

aliases.name: Model
aliases.comment: The core representation of state entity is mostly a list of attributes.

values.name: asAttributesIn
values.comment: Assign attributes to an entity

values.name: setAttributes
values.comment: Assign attributes to an entity

name: Bubblegum.Entity.SettingsEntity
comment:
A settings entity represents some configuration that could be applied to a widget

@docs Model, setAttributes, asAttributesIn

aliases.name: Model
aliases.comment: The core representation of settings entity is mostly a list of attributes.

values.name: asAttributesIn
values.comment: Assign attributes to an entity

values.name: setAttributes
values.comment: Assign attributes to an entity

name: Bubblegum.Entity.Transformation
comment:
List of functions that can applied to an Outcome

@docs addStringPrefix, addStringSuffix

values.name: addStringPrefix
values.comment: Apply a string prefix to an outcome

values.name: addStringSuffix
values.comment: Apply a string suffix to an outcome

name: Bubblegum.Entity.Attribute

aliases.name: Model
aliases.comment:
The core representation of an attribute with:

  - id: a possible id to represent the attribute (ex: id:1234)
  - key: the key of the attribute (ex: ui:label)
  - values: a list of string values
  - facets: an optional list of tags to mark the data (ex: [min])

When representing a RDF triple:

  - subject: should be represented by id
  - predicate: should be represented by key
  - object: should be represented by values
aliases.type: { id : Maybe.Maybe String , key : String , values : List String , facets : List String }

values.name: deleteAttributeByKey
values.comment:
Delete an attribute by key

    deleteAttributeByKey "ui:label" models -- []

values.name: findAttributeByKey
values.comment:
Find an attribute by key

    findAttributeByKey "ui:label" models -- Just label

values.name: findAttributeFirstValueByKey
values.comment:
Find an attribute by key and then get the first value if any

    findAttributeFirstValueByKey "ui:label" models -- Just "some label"

values.name: findOutcomeByKey
values.comment:
Find an outcome searching by key

    findOutcomeByKey "ui:label" models -- Valid ["some label"]

values.name: findOutcomeByKeyTuple
values.comment:
Find an outcome searching by a couple of keys

    findOutcomeByKeyTuple ("ui:min", "ui:max") models -- Valid (["1"], ["10"])
values.type: ( String, String ) -> List Bubblegum.Entity.Attribute.Model -> Bubblegum.Entity.Outcome.Outcome ( List String, List String )

values.name: replaceAttributeByKey
values.comment:
Replace or create an attribute by key

     replaceAttributeByKey "ui:label" ["new label"] models -- models
values.type: String -> List String -> List Bubblegum.Entity.Attribute.Model -> List Bubblegum.Entity.Attribute.Model

values.name: setFacets
values.comment:
Set an optional list of tags to mark the data

    setFacets ["min", "inclusive"] model

values.name: setId
values.comment:
Set a possible id to represent the attribute

     setId (Just "id:1234") model

values.name: setKey
values.comment:
Set the key of the attribute

    setKey "ui:label" model

values.name: setValues
values.comment:
Set a list of string values

    setValues ["some label"] model

name: Bubblegum.Entity.Outcome

types.name: Outcome
types.comment:
Representation of an outcome which can be:

  - Valid: a valid value, similar to Just of Maybe.
  - None: no value, similar to Nothing of Maybe.
  - Warning: a warning message, similar to Err of Result.

values.name: check
values.comment:
Check that a valid outcome verifies the criteria otherwise raise a warning

    check String.isEmpty "should not be empty string" (Valid "some text" ) -- Valid "some text"
    check String.isEmpty "should not be empty string" (Valid "" ) -- Warning "should not be empty string"
values.type: (a -> Bool) -> String -> Bubblegum.Entity.Outcome.Outcome a -> Bubblegum.Entity.Outcome.Outcome a

values.name: checkOrNone
values.comment:
Check that a valid outcome verifies the criteria otherwise return none

    checkOrNone String.isEmpty (Valid "some text" ) -- Valid "some text"
    checkOrNone String.isEmpty (Valid "" ) -- None

values.name: fromMaybe
values.comment:
Convert a maybe to an outcome

    fromMaybe (Just "str") -- Valid "str"
    fromMaybe Nothing -- None

values.name: isNone
values.comment: Return true if the outcome is none

values.name: isValid
values.comment: Return true if the outcome is valid

values.name: isWarning
values.comment: Return true if the outcome is none

values.name: map
values.comment:
Apply a function to an outcome. If the result is `Valid`, it will be converted.
If the outcome is a `Warning` or `None`, the same value will propagate through.
map sqrt (Valid 4.0) == Valid 2.0

values.name: map2
values.comment:
Apply a function to two outcomes, if both outcome are `Valid`. If not,
a valid outcome and a None will propagate None, a Warning will always propagate.
Two warnings will be merged
values.type: (a -> b -> value) -> Bubblegum.Entity.Outcome.Outcome a -> Bubblegum.Entity.Outcome.Outcome b -> Bubblegum.Entity.Outcome.Outcome value

values.name: or
values.comment:
Like the boolean '||' this will return the first value that is positive ('Valid').

    or (None) (Valid "str") -- Valid "str"
values.type: Bubblegum.Entity.Outcome.Outcome a -> Bubblegum.Entity.Outcome.Outcome a -> Bubblegum.Entity.Outcome.Outcome a

values.name: toMaybe
values.comment:
Convert an outcome to a maybe

    toMaybe (Valid "str") -- Just "str"
    toMaybe None -- Nothing

values.name: trueMapToConstant
values.comment:
An outcome with a true value will produce a constant outcome

    trueMapToConstant ["alpha"] (Valid True ) -- Valid ["alpha"]
    trueMapToConstant ["alpha"] (Valid False ) -- None

values.name: withDefault
values.comment:
If the outcome is `Valid` return the value. If the outcome is a `None` then
return a given default value. If the outcome is a `Warning` then propagate this warning.
